mods.abstract: Negro-Woman in Jail. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 30th November last, a Negro-Woman, calling herself Constance, and her son, named Octave, aged about six years ; the mother is aged about 30 years, five feet high, bling of the left eye and speaks French and English. Constance says she belongs to Mr. Adolphe Boudreau, residing on Bayour Teche, in the Parish of St. Landry, from whom she runaway since the 29th November last. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take them away, otherwise they will be disposed of according to law. LOUIS L. BOUTTE, Jailor. Opelousas, December 2d, 1854.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
